items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is possible throughout today, Monday 29th November. Water levels are likely to remain higher than usual for the next 24 hours. This is due to the weather conditions associated with Storm Arwen. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth is currently restricting the normal drainage of the Broads river system out to sea at low tide. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 10:00am tomorrow, Tuesday 30th November.

River levels are rising at the Upper Tean river gauge as a result of rapid snowmelt and rainfall overnight. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible this morning 30/11/2021. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Churnet between Leek and Rocester and the River Tean between Adderley and Spath including Cecilly Brook at Cheadle.   
Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. We expect river levels to remain high until this afternoon 30/11/2021. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated this afternoon, 30/11/2021, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Ilam river gauge as a result of rapid snowmelt and rainfall overnight. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this morning 30/11/2021. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Dove between Izaak Walton and Rocester and the Henmore Brook between Carsington Dam and Mayfield.   
Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until this afternoon 30/11/2021.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated this afternoon, 30/11/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: River levels in the upper River Derwent catchment have fallen below the levels of concern. We continue to monitor the situation. Please check the GOV.UK website for up to date information for the next 5 days

items.description: The tidal River Waveney from Ellingham to Breydon Water
items.message: Water levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.
